description: Dyer's chamomile (Anthemis tinctoria 'Kelwayi') is a unique and amazing plant. It has attractive small, daisy-like bright yellow flowers that provides a cheerful display in the garden. These flowers give out a sweet scent when they bloom in the summer. This species is a particularly hardy and vigorous variety of chamomile which makes it ideal for decorating gardens and flower beds. In addition, the plant is drought tolerant and adaptable to different soil conditions. Above all, the flowers can be harvested for a variety of uses, from adding vibrant color to dyeing fabrics. This makes Dyer's chamomile a great choice for ornamental gardens and dyeing projects.
